content.description: Slopey side pulls & edges up the blunt arete
content.location: The arete just left of " Quiet Soul "

content.description: The tallest boulder in the meadow. This line follows the 45-degree over hanging arete. Start on low pinch on arete and right on the long crimp rail with left heel in the half moon.
content.location: Follow faint climber trail up the hill and into a grassy meadow. turn left and walk over the ridge.

content.description: Start left of the arete. Climb the face, using pebbles and other thin holds, moving right halfway up and finish Rapunzul.
Pocketed face right of the tree. A hard move half way up gains a good 3-finger pocket which leads to scary top-out. The top-out foot is fragile.
content.location: The Keep.

content.description: Edges up the vertical face
content.location:
Instead of going left for "campus problem" & "Quiet soul" etc.

keep going down the main trail, south more or less. 1st boulder on the left with big pine branch hanging over it.

West facing

content.description: Sit start in scoop and move up using awkward angled holds.
content.location: As you walk through Enlightenment campground and pass the highball 'Enlightenment', walk 60- 100 feet and it's the first boulder on the trail to your right. It's on the Lizard Lips boulder and it's directly facing and opposite of Losing my Marbles.

content.description: Start with a left hand on a gritty crimp and a good right hand. Move high and left to tiny crimp nubbin and use good feet and an undercling to gain patina and slopers for the top out.
content.protection: A pad to get up and to jump off the boulder onto to get down. Have a friend move the pad around the corner or downclimb the dirty crack to the right.
content.location: On the backside of the boulder with Crystal Groove on the direct opposite side.

content.description: On the left arete starting on the big rail. Top out straight up.
content.location: Left side.

content.description: A 2-3 move locker finger crack up to a optional offwidth move or two OR move to the left and top out on patina jugs
content.location: Pass Rapunzel, Softly Softly and Cravings in that order and head downhill in the obvious sandy gully. The climb will be on your left.

content.description: Red, green and orange face. Start on Twin gastons to crimps to more crimps to hueco. Brilliant!
content.location: Down the trail from the campsite.

content.description: Scoop to the "Chalice" or the jug
content.location: On the "sperm" boulder behind the rapunzel boulder

content.description: Start on the right side of the wall next to the arete and climb through juggy plates the whole way.
content.location: Facing downhill, continue down the faint trail from Quiet Soul boulder and it will be the next major boulder

content.description: Sit down start on a cobbly ledge. Climb up and left on slopers to a horizontal seam. Fix your feet on good rock and pump for the big edge on top. Very fun.
content.location: From the road, follow the trail behind the Enlightenment Ridge campsite downhill past the campsite boulders to a fork heading left. Pass the fork and continue on the main trail for a second and look to your right. The first boulder is called Lizard Lips, right next to it is Flabby Cabby. Losing My Marbles is on the Flabby Cabby boulder, all the way to the right in the overhang.

content.description: High step onto fragile looking side pulls gets you high enough to worry about the toe of wall below you. Exciting but never desperate.
content.location: First couple boulders south and west of campsite 3. Left most problem on the N side of a small corridor.

content.description: Start on slots at corner and move up and right. Crux involves a sharp crimp towards the end
content.location: From the rapunzel boulder go down and right. Problem starts on corner of smaller boulder facing downhill. Distinctive red slots on face.

content.description: Climb up the scoops and get your feet up for a reachy top out. Drop off the other side.
content.location:
Liposuction Dents

is one of five known problems on what is called

The She Boulder

. While driving on Pine Mountain Rd, just before you reach the Chorro Grande trailhead the pavements ends. Right near this point on the uphill side of the road, 20 feet from the road sits

The She Boulder

. Easily identified by its dents and "lips".

content.description: Sit start with a long reach out right. Mind the flakes, they're a little shakey.
content.location:
From the road, follow the trail that leads down the ridge from behind the last camsite on the mountain. After about a minute of walking, a fork in the trail leading down to the left will appear. Follow this fork to a clearing, the large boulder to your right is the

Campus Boulder

, the boulder straight ahead with the green lichen on it is called

Quite Soul

. Walk past

Quite Soul

around some scattered boulders to another clearing. To your right is the

Karma Redux

boulder and to your left is the

Reese's Arete

boulder. Straight ahead is an unlisted V0 SDS out of a little cave.

Semi-Conscious

and

Goose Bumps

are on the downhill(back)side of Karma Redux.

content.description:
The classic highball and an area favorite.

Climb the obvious arete on good holds to a high top out. Descend via the opposite side of the boulder. A large tree helps.
content.location:
Walking east along from the road, having passed Happy Hunting Grounds (the main area),

Rapunzel

is the obvious aréte on the huge boulder down and right.

content.description: Sit start to pockets and smooth knobs, easy.
content.location:
From the road, follow the trail that leads down the ridge from behind the last camsite on the mountain. After about a minute of walking, a fork in the trail leading down to the left will appear. Follow this fork to a clearing, the large boulder to your right is the

Campus Boulder

, the boulder straight ahead with the green lichen on it is called

Quite Soul

. Walk past

Quite Soul

around some scattered boulders to another clearing. To your right is the

Karma Redux

boulder and to your left is the

Reese's Arete

boulder. Straight ahead is an unlisted V0 SDS out of a little cave.

Semi-Conscious

and

Goose Bumps

are on the downhill(back)side of

Karma Redux

.

content.description: Huecos to a side-pull/under cling to a crimp. Then find the small holds over the top and mantle up
content.location: Just left of the tree that is 8 ft. Left of "To Die For"

climbs.name: Huggy bear a.k.a. Who the Hell is Rob Zeemer?

content.description: Bear hug the blunt arete with tiny pockets, slopey side-pulls & edges to a glory jug at the top. Great problem!
content.location: Across the trail from "Trinity" about 50 ft. away is a boulder with a huge dead tree laying on it. The south facing blunt arete. Easy walk-off down the dead tree

content.description: Beautiful proud line. Follow pebbles and sloping edges to a nice but big move at the end when it's scariest. Also called "Aztec Warrior" by Darren Odgers, Juan Carlo and many others because we don't live in France and I don't know how to pronounce that crap.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter at the beginning half because the route spits you off towards the rock below.
content.location: Around the right side on the Rapunzel boulder.

content.description: Work edges up the face to a slopey top-out
content.location: On the "sperm" boulder behind the rapunzel boulder.

content.description: Climb the big chicken heads up the center of the face, fun and tall.
content.location:
From the road, follow the trail that leads down the ridge from behind the last camsite on the mountain. After about a minute of walking, a fork in the trail leading down to the left will appear. Follow this fork to a clearing, the large boulder to your right is the

Campus Boulder

, the boulder straight ahead with the green lichen on it is called

Quite Soul

. Walk past

Quite Soul

around some scattered boulders to another clearing. To your right is the

Karma Redux

boulder and to your left is the

Reese's Arete

boulder. Straight ahead is an unlisted V0 SDS out of a little cave.

Semi-Conscious

and

Gooze Bumps

are on the downhill(back)side of

Karma Redux

.

content.description: Sit start with left hand on the big side pull, right hand squeezing on a low sloper. Move up to the sloping rail on the face and bust out right to a sharp crimp plate. Heel hookery and some fresh squeezies awaits. Either charge straight up or escape out left.
content.location: Behind the tree to the left of Crystal Groove, on the blunt arete.

content.description: Potential new problem on Enlightenment Ridge (not in Ocean's 11 guidebook).  Bottom holds were chalked but the topout was covered in dirt and lichen so we suspect undone. Start sitting in dihedral on good holds. Engaging deadpoints on good edges lead to sloping three-finger dish on arete. From there, small edges lead to a technical topout up the slab.  FA on 9/15/18 with second ascent by Nathan Bradford and third ascent by Jackson Adair the same day.  Left start remains a project.  Named for my grandfather, a Flying Tiger in WW2.
content.location: Faces West, one gully west of To Die For on enlightenment ridge, 50 meters downhill of the road. Look for large left-hand sidepull at head-height.

content.description: Sit down start, climb the left edge of the boulder on knob and seams and stuff.
content.location:
From the road, follow the trail behind the Enlightenment Ridge campsite downhill past the campsite boulders to a fork heading left. Pass the fork and continue on the main trail for a second and look to your right. The first boulder is called

Lizard Lips

, right next to it is

Flabby Cabby

.

content.description: off the pebble and up on sketch slab
content.location: on the backside of the campsite 3 boulders

content.description: Technical, burly, and all around wonderful pine mountain slopers. High start with a right hand dish and and do some foot magic to hit the higher left hand. Top out with some slapping!
content.location: behind repunzel boulder facing the sperm

content.description: Start with a left hand in the obvious slot (same start hands as Longing for Yearning), move up to the other large mail slot and then look for a very hard to see crimp to your high left. From there it's sloper madness to mantle the top. Extra points for topping straight over the buldge instead of escaping far right.
content.protection: A pad and believe it or not, a spotter to tell you where your feet are. It's blind up there.
content.location: Go past The Rapunzel boulder on the right side, past Softly, Softly and down another 30 feet. Boulder will be on your left. Same boulder as Longing for Yearning.

content.description:
Begin from a sit and pull a couple tough moves to gain the hueco. Moving off the hueco, make some big moves for the top.

The standing start is V6.
content.location:
Easily seen from the road, downhill, just before the last campsite. On the huge

Rapunzel

boulder. Sit-start just right of the tree.

content.description: Sit start under the roof crack and move directly out for slopers and a really satisfactory mantel.
content.location: Head towards Quiet Soul. It's on the South side of the Campus Problem boulder under the roof crack.

content.description:
The Chorro Loaf has three problems on the southeast corner and possibly another on the other side.

The Chorro Grande Loaf, V2. SS tricky sloper start. R wall off. Awkward.

Half-a-Loaf, V0. SS up the corner.

Pinch-a-Loaf, V0. Horizontal crack to start.

The back side of the Loaf has a short roof to mantle SS.

the rock quality is OK, but the problem are prolly better suited for the vertically challanged or kids.
content.location: From the Campus Boulder, walk east downhill until you reach the Chorro Grande trail(about 3 minutes). The Chorro Loaf is on the downhill side of the trail.

content.description: Start Losing Your Marbles but make another move to the next sloper loaf and top out from there.
content.location: Find Losing Your Marbles and sit start there.

content.description: Sit start on decent holds and make a big move out right. A few more moves to a large hueco and you’re done.
content.location: From the campsite, hike towards Quiet Soul. The boulder will be on your right

content.description: Slopes & crimps up steep face
content.location:
Same start as " Campus Problem " but go straight up.

Avoiding the big hueco

content.description: Get set under the bulge, and work your way up on good holds to the arete, top out to your left.
content.location: From the last campsite on the mountain, head west downhill to the first set of boulders on your right. Blade Runner is the problem furtherest to the right facing the road.

content.description: Sit start in the cave and use stem techniques the reach high up to some good holds.
content.location: On the Lizard Lips boulder (including Stem Gem (not)) but facing the big red boulder on the West side.
